content.description:
Engaging climbing on relatively easy ground. Rock quality is variable, protection somewhat sparse.

P1. Climb up bulges and slabs heading toward a 4 m dihedral below a left trending gulley. Climb the dihedral with good pro and a delicate top out into the gully. A good anchor can be had halfway up the gulley. 

P2. Climb the gully up to a chossy bulge. Pro to the left. Decent sticks in (hopefully) frozen sod surmount the bulge. Continue to the top with good pro.

Located roughly in the middle of the wall.
Cams to 3", no screws.

A secluded crag above Whitehorse. Mostly choss with a few alright looking lines for both summer and winter. Best climbed after a long thaw-freeze period when choss is cemented and soil/moss is frozen. Feels pretty alpine. 
  
 I suspect people have poked around on this wall before. If it already has a name, please update.
